Detailed Description

This class contains all abbreviation strings that are used for the (dynamic) strings in the MapCentral system.

E.g (in Swedish) "GATAN" is abbreviated as "G.". Here is also methods to expand a string with abbreviations to its full name, e.g. (in Swedish) "Ö VALLG." is expanded to "ÖSTRA VALLGATAN".

All functions are declaered static.

NB! Currently a linear-search is done among all the strings. As long as the number of abbreviations are small this does not matter, but if this increase this must be optimized. For example by building a better/faster datastructure runtime.

Definition at line 39 of file AbbreviationTable.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AbbreviationTable::pos_t
 

The allowed position of the abbreviation/expansion in the string.

Used in the static abbreviation-table.

Enumeration values:
beginning  The full name of the abbreviation must come first in the source string.
end  The full name of the abbreviation must come last in the source string.
beginningAndEnd  The full name of the abbreviation can come either first or last in the source string.
centre  The full name of the abbreviation can come everywhere in in the string, except first and last in the string..
anywhere  The full name of the abbreviation can come everywhere in the string.
word  The full name of the abbreviation must be a full word (with whitspaces on both sides) in the source string.

Member Function Documentation

bool AbbreviationTable::abbrevAllowed (  pos_t  inPos,
pos_t  tablePos,
bool  toAbbreviate
)  [static, private]
 

Returns true if the inPos allows abbrevations/expansions of type tablePos.

Returns:
true (for now).

char* AbbreviationTable::abbreviate (  const char *  src,
char *  dest,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
AbbreviationTable::pos_t  pos,
StringTable::countryCode  country = StringTable::NBR_COUNTRY_CODES
)  [static]
 

Abbreviate a given string with a given language.

The destination string must be at least as big as the source string. NB! No check that the result fits into the destination string is performed, but it is guarenteed that the result not is longer than the source.

Parameters:
src The source string that contains the string that should be abbreviated.
dest A preallocated buffer where the result is written.
lang The language of the source string.
pos Which part of the string that is going to be abbreviated.
country In which country the source string is located, detecting country specific abbreviation. Default is NBR_COUNTRY_CODES = no specific country.
Returns:
A pointer to the destination string.

bool AbbreviationTable::abbrevMatches (  const char *  origStr,
const char *  foundPos,
const char *  foundAbbrev,
pos_t  abbrevPos,
uint32  abbrevNbrInTable,
bool  toAbbreviate,
bool  singelWordExpand = false,
bool  manageAddress = true
)  [static, private]
 

Returns true if the abbrevation/expansion matches.

Parameters:
origStr String to look in.
foundPos Pointer to the place where long/short string was found.
abbrevPos The position where the abbrev is allowed, from the m_abbreviations/m_expansions table.
abbrevElement The element from the m_abbreviations/m_expansions table to check.
toAbbreviate Tells whether to check matching for abbreviation or for expansion of the string.
singleWordExpand Set to True if the origString is one single word. Default value is False, the origStr must not be a single word.
manageAddress Default is true, the string to manage is address and m_abbreviations or m_expansions tables will be used. Set false if the string to check is an area (e.g. city or municipal) and the area abbrev and expand tables should be used instead.
Returns:
True if the checks were ok.

vector<abbreviation_tommi_t> AbbreviationTable::convAbbrev (  const abbreviation_t *  table,
int  nbrAbb
)  [static, private]
 

Converts the entries in a table to the ones using MC2String.

char* AbbreviationTable::expand (  const char *  src,
char *  dest,
size_t  maxLen,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
AbbreviationTable::pos_t  pos,
StringTable::countryCode  country = StringTable::NBR_COUNTRY_CODES,
bool  manageAddress = true
)  [static]
 

Expand the abbreviations in a string and print the result into a new string.

Parameters:
src The source string containing the abbreviations.
dest A preallocated buffer where the result is written.
maxLen The maximum number of charactes that will be written into dest.
lang The language of the source string.
pos Which part of the string that is going to be expanded.
country In which country the source string is located, detecting country specific abbreviation. Default is NBR_COUNTRY_CODES =no specific country.
manageAddress Default set to true, the string to expand is an address (m_expansions table will be used). Set false if the string is an area (e.g. city or municipal) and the area expansions table should be used instead.
Returns:
A pointer to the destination string. NULL is returned if the result did not fit inte dest (the resulting string is (would have been) longer than maxLen bytes).

vector<MC2String> AbbreviationTable::fullExpand (  const char *  src,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
StringTable::countryCode  country = StringTable::NBR_COUNTRY_CODES,
bool  manageAddress = true
)  [static]
 

Expands to all possible expansion alternatives, returning a vector.

The source string is split in single words and each word expanded to all possibilities considering language and country. The expanded single words are joined to several strings with all possible expansion alternatives.

Parameters:
src The source string to expand.
lang The language of the source string.
country The country in which to expand. Default is numberCountryCodes meaning no country.
manageAddress Default set to true, the string to expand is an address (m_expansions table will be used). Set false if the string is an area (e.g. city or municipal) and the area expansions table should be used instead.
Returns:
A vector of strings containing the possible expansions of the source string. Only strings not equal to the src string are added to this vector.

int AbbreviationTable::getExpandPosition (  const char *  src,
uint32  i,
AbbreviationTable::pos_t  pos
)  [static, private]
 

Get the position of the abbreviation to expand in a string.

Parameters:
src The unexpanded string.
i The index of the abbreviation to check. Valid values are 0..m_nbrExpansions-1.
Returns:
The position of abbreviation number i in src. A negative value is returned if abbreviation number i don not fit in src.

char* AbbreviationTable::helpExpand (  const char *  src,
char *  dest,
size_t  maxLen,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
StringTable::countryCode  country,
AbbreviationTable::pos_t  pos,
bool  singleWordExpand,
vector< MC2String > &  expandedStrings,
bool  manageAddress
)  [static, private]
 

Help method for expanding.

Serves both the normal expand, and the fullExpand funtion.

Parameters:
src The source string containing the abbreviations.
dest A preallocated buffer where the result is written.
maxLen The maximum number of charactes that will be written into dest.
lang The language of the source string.
country In which country the source string is located, detecting country specific abbreviation. If no specific country give NBR_COUNTRY_CODES.
pos Which part of the string that is going to be expanded.
singleWordExpand Tells if the origString is one single word (true), or not.
expandedStrings A vector of strings that will contain the possible expansions of the source string.
manageAddress Set to true if the string to expand is an address (m_expansions table will be used). Set false if the string is an area (e.g. city or municipal) and the area expansions table should be used instead.
Returns:
A pointer to the destination string. NULL is returned if the result did not fit inte dest (the resulting string is (would have been) longer than maxLen bytes).

char* AbbreviationTable::oldExpand (  const char *  src,
char *  dest,
size_t  maxLen,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
AbbreviationTable::pos_t  pos,
bool &  expanded
)  [static]
 

Old expand method.

Will be removed since there is another better expand method. For param documentation, see the expand method.

int AbbreviationTable::strncmp_alnum (  const char *  s1,
const char *  s2,
size_t  n
)  [static, private]
 

Replacement of the strncmp-method that compares the first n characters in two strings, but also use the m_nonAlnumChar.

If any of the parameters are NULL, 0 will be returned!

Parameters:
s1 One of the strings that will be compared.
s2 One of the strings that will be compared.
n The number of characters in s1 and s2 that (maximum) will be compared.
Returns:
A negative value of s1 is less than s2, zero if s1 == s2 and a positive value of s1 is greater than s2.
